MachineState.Name: AdvanceCurrentReminder
MachineState.Description: Advances the medication reminder to the next scheduled time.

MachineState.Name: Idle
MachineState.Description: The system is in a standby mode, waiting for interaction or the next event.

MachineState.Name: MovementDetected
MachineState.Description: Detects confirmed movement, signaling a completed interaction.

MachineState.Name: WaitForCommands
MachineState.Description: Enters a mode waiting for user commands through the main interface.

MachineState.Name: Reboot
MachineState.Description: Reinitializes the system, effectively restarting it.

MachineState.Name: WaitForMoreMovement
MachineState.Description: Awaits additional movement to confirm or complete an action.

MachineState.Name: CountMovement
MachineState.Description: Counts valid movement events for processing.

MachineState.Name: Bootup
MachineState.Description: Initializes the system and prepares for operation.

MachineState.Name: GatherReminders
MachineState.Description: Awaits the time for the first medication reminder.

MachineState.Name: SaveReminders
MachineState.Description: Captures the current time as a reference point for tracking.

MachineState.Name: DebounceMovement
MachineState.Description: Filters out false movements to ensure accurate detection.

MachineState.Name: SetExpectedReminder
MachineState.Description: Enables setting a new time for the next medication reminder.

Transition.Description: Counts validated wheel movement towards medication adherence tracking.
Transition.Name: DebounceMovement-to-CountMovement-after--DebouncePassed

Transition.Description: Allows the user to set a new medication reminder through double-clicking.
Transition.Name: WaitForCommands-to-SetExpectedReminder-after--MainInputDoubleClick

Transition.Description: Filters out false wheel movements to prevent erroneous operations.
Transition.Name: Idle-to-DebounceMovement-after--WheelMoved

Transition.Description: Initializes the recording of the current time slice immediately after system startup
Transition.Name: Bootup-to-GatherReminders-after-15000-BootupComplete

Transition.Description: Updates the current medication reminder schedule upon user request.
Transition.Name: WaitForCommands-to-AdvanceCurrentReminder-after--MainInputClick

Transition.Description: Waits for the first medication reminder after the initial setup is completed.
Transition.Name: GatherReminders-to-SaveReminders-after--RemindersGather

Transition.Description: Transitions to idle after the user has set and confirmed the expected time for the next reminder.
Transition.Name: SetExpectedReminder-to-Idle-after--ExpectedReminderSet

Transition.Description: Monitors for additional wheel movement to confirm continuous user interaction.
Transition.Name: CountMovement-to-WaitForMoreMovement-after--MovementCounted

Transition.Description: Restarts the system, moving from the reboot phase back to the initial operational state.
Transition.Name: Reboot-to-Bootup-after--RebootStarted

Transition.Description: Triggers a system reboot when the main input is held down, allowing for maintenance or updates.
Transition.Name: WaitForCommands-to-Reboot-after--MainInputHold

Transition.Description: Enters command waiting state in response to user interaction via main input.
Transition.Name: Idle-to-WaitForCommands-after--MainInputClick

Transition.Description: Resumes idle state after the current medication reminder has been successfully advanced.
Transition.Name: AdvanceCurrentReminder-to-Idle-after--CurrentReminderAdvanced

Transition.Description: Increments movement count upon further detected wheel movements.
Transition.Name: WaitForMoreMovement-to-CountMovement-after--WheelMoved

Transition.Description: Completes processing of movement and awaits further user interaction.
Transition.Name: MovementDetected-to-Idle-after--MovementHandled

Transition.Description: Returns to idle on failing to validate the wheel movement (debouncing).
Transition.Name: DebounceMovement-to-Idle-after--DebounceFailed

Transition.Description: Finalizes the movement count if no additional wheel activity is detected.
Transition.Name: WaitForMoreMovement-to-MovementDetected-after--WheelNotMoved

PartLink.Name: Pin-06-Bit2SensorPin
PartLink.Description: Pin-6 also connects to a blue Latching Switch through the latch_bit2_latching_switch wire to lock the second bit's state.

PartLink.Name: Pin-04-Bit1SensorPin
PartLink.Description: The latch_bit1_latching_switch wire from Pin-4 to a white Latching Switch captures the first bit's physical state changes.

PartLink.Name: Pin-06-Bit2SensorPin
PartLink.Description: The sense_bit2_hall_effect_sensor wire from Pin-6 to a blue Hall Effect Sensor detects the magnetic changes for the second bit.

PartLink.Name: Pin-09-WheelLedPin
PartLink.Description: Pin-9's wheel_status_led wire attaches to a red LED, which shows the wheel movement status, reflecting medication dispensing actions.

PartLink.Name: Pin-05-Bit2LedPin
PartLink.Description: From Pin-5, the bit2_status_led wire leads to a blue LED displaying the second bit's status linked to medication events.

PartLink.Name: Pin-04-Bit1SensorPin
PartLink.Description: Connecting Pin-4 to a white Hall Effect Sensor, the sense_bit1_hall_effect_sensor wire senses the first bit's magnetic field change.

PartLink.Name: Pin-02-SpeakerPin
PartLink.Description: The status_beeps_speaker wire connects Pin-2 to a speaker emitting auditory beeps for status alerts in an orange color.

PartLink.Name: Pin-08-AmPmSensorPin
PartLink.Description: Also from Pin-8, the latch_am_pm_latching_switch wire links to a yellow Latching Switch for AM/PM state capture.

PartLink.Name: Pin-11-StatusLedPin
PartLink.Description: Finally, the status_status_led wire leads from Pin-11 to an orange LED for general status indication of the system.

PartLink.Name: Pin-07-AmPmLedPin
PartLink.Description: A yellow LED connected by the am_pm_status_led wire from Pin-7 indicates the AM or PM medication status.

PartLink.Name: Pin-10-WheelSensorPin
PartLink.Description: The latch_wheel_latching_switch wire from Pin-10 to a red Latching Switch secures the wheel's position post-movement.

PartLink.Name: Pin-08-AmPmSensorPin
PartLink.Description: The sense_am_pm_hall_effect_sensor wire from Pin-8 connects to a yellow Hall Effect Sensor to detect AM/PM status changes.

PartLink.Name: Pin-03-Bit1LedPin
PartLink.Description: The bit1_status_led wire runs from Pin-3 to a white LED indicating the status of the first bit for medication timing.

PartLink.Name: Pin-10-WheelSensorPin
PartLink.Description: Connecting Pin-10 to a red Hall Effect Sensor, the sense_wheel_hall_effect_sensor wire monitors wheel movements for medication timings.
